name: Titanium.Cloud.Reviews
doc:
@platform android 0.8 @platform blackberry 3.1.2 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/Cloud/Reviews/Reviews.yml

Provides methods for accessing ACS reviews.

Examples

Create Review

This example creates a new review and checks the response.

Cloud.Reviews.create({
    post_id: savedPostId,
    rating: 1,
    content: 'Good'
}, function (e) {
    if (e.success) {
        var review = e.reviews[0];
        alert('Success:\n' +
            'id: ' + review.id + '\n' +
            'rating: ' + review.rating + '\n' +
            'content: ' + review.content + '\n' +
            'updated_at: ' + review.updated_at);
    } else {
        alert('Error:\n' +
            ((e.error && e.message) || JSON.stringify(e)));
    }
});

Show a Review

This example retrieves information about a review and checks the response.

Cloud.Reviews.show({
    post_id: savedPostId,
    review_id: savedReviewId
}, function (e) {
    if (e.success) {
        var review = e.reviews[0];
        alert('Success:\n' +
            'id: ' + review.id + '\n' +
            'rating: ' + review.rating + '\n' +
            'content: ' + review.content + '\n' +
            'updated_at: ' + review.updated_at);
    } else {
        alert('Error:\n' +
            ((e.error && e.message) || JSON.stringify(e)));
    }
});

Query for Reviews

This example requests a list of reviews and checks the response.

Cloud.Reviews.query({
    page: 1,
    per_page: 20,
    where: {
        rating: { '$gt': 5.0 }
    }
}, function (e) {
    if (e.success) {
        alert('Success:\n' +
            'Count: ' + e.reviews.length);
        for (var i = 0; i < e.reviews.length; i++) {
            var review = e.reviews[i];
            alert('id: ' + review.id + '\n' +
                'id: ' + review.id + '\n' +
                'rating: ' + review.rating + '\n' +
                'content: ' + review.content + '\n' +
                'updated_at: ' + review.updated_at);
        }
    } else {
        alert('Error:\n' +
            ((e.error && e.message) || JSON.stringify(e)));
    }
});

Update a Review

This example updates a review and checks the response.

Cloud.Reviews.update({
    post_id: savedPostId,
    review_id: savedReviewId,
    rating: 100,
    content: 'Very good!'
}, function (e) {
    if (e.success) {
        var review = e.reviews[0];
        alert('Success:\n' +
            'id: ' + review.id + '\n' +
            'rating: ' + review.rating + '\n' +
            'content: ' + review.content + '\n' +
            'updated_at: ' + review.updated_at);
    } else {
        alert('Error:\n' +
            ((e.error && e.message) || JSON.stringify(e)));
    }
});

Remove a Review

This example deletes a review and checks the response.

Cloud.Reviews.remove({
    post_id: savedPostId,
    review_id: savedReviewId
}, function (e) {
    if (e.success) {
        alert('Success');
    } else {
        alert('Error:\n' +
            ((e.error && e.message) || JSON.stringify(e)));
    }
});

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to invoke when the event is fired.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: create
method.doc:
Add a review, comment, rating, or like.

@description

Requires user login.

See Reviews: Create Review/Comment/Rating/Like for the request parameters supported by this method.

Data is returned in the reviews property of the parameter passed to the callback.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

method.shortDoc: Add a review, comment, rating, or like. ...

method.name: fireEvent
method.doc: Fires a synthesized event to any registered listeners.

params.name: event
params.doc: A dictionary of keys and values to add to the Titanium.Event object sent to the listeners.

method.shortDoc: Fires a synthesized event to any registered listeners. ...

method.name: getApiName
method.doc: Gets the value of the apiName property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the apiName property. ...

method.name: getBubbleParent
method.doc: Gets the value of the bubbleParent property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the bubbleParent property. ...

method.name: getLifecycleContainer
method.doc: Gets the value of the lifecycleContainer property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the lifecycleContainer property. ...

method.doc:
Retrieve a list of reviews with sorting and pagination.

@description

See Reviews: Custom Query Reviews/Comments/Ratings/Likes for the request parameters supported by this method.

Data is returned in the reviews property of the parameter passed to the callback.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

method.shortDoc: Retrieve a list of reviews with sorting and pagination. ...

method.name: remove
method.doc:
Delete a review.

@description

Requires user login.

See Reviews: Delete a Review/Comment/Rating/Like for the request parameters supported by this method.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...
